t: Zechariah 9
Israel Defended Against Enemies
The*pn burden of the word of the Lord*s Against*ld the land of Hadrach, And*ld Damascus its resting place (For*ld the eyes of men And*ld all the tribes of Israel Are*ld on the Lord);*s
Also*ld against*i Hamath, which*i borders on it, And*ld against*i Tyre and Sidon, though they are very wise.
For*ln Tyre built herself a tower, Heaped*ld up silver like the dust, And*ld gold like the mire of the streets.
Behold,*ld the Lord will cast her out; He*ld will destroy her power in the sea, And*ld she will be devoured by fire.
Ashkelon*ln shall see it*i and fear; Gaza*ld also shall be very sorrowful; And*ld Ekron, for He dried up her expectation. The*ld king shall perish from Gaza, And*ld Ashkelon shall not be inhabited.
“A*ln mixed race shall settle in Ashdod, And*ld I will cut off the pride of the Philistines.

I*ld will take away the blood from his mouth, And*ld the abominations from between his teeth. But*ld he who remains, even he shall*i be*i for our God, And*ld shall be like a leader in Judah, And*ld Ekron like a Jebusite.
I*ld will camp around My house Because*ld of the army, Because*ld of him who passes by and him who returns. No*ld more shall an oppressor pass through them, For*ld now I have seen with My eyes.
The Coming King

“Rejoice*pn greatly, O daughter of Zion! Shout,*ld O daughter of Jerusalem! Behold,*ld your King is coming to you; He*ld is*i just and having salvation, Lowly*ld and riding on a donkey, A*ld colt, the foal of a donkey.

I*ld will cut off the chariot from Ephraim And*ld the horse from Jerusalem; The*ld battle bow shall be cut off. He*ld shall speak peace to the nations; His*ld dominion shall*i be*i ‘from sea to sea, And*ld from the River to the ends of the earth.’
God Will Save His People
“As*pn for you also, Because*ld of the blood of your covenant, I*ld will set your prisoners free from the waterless pit.
Return*ld to the stronghold, You*ld prisoners of hope. Even*ld today I declare That*ild I will restore double to you.
For*ld I have bent Judah, My bow,*i Fitted*ld the bow with Ephraim, And*ld raised up your sons, O Zion, Against*ld your sons, O Greece, And*ld made you like the sword of a mighty man.”
Then*ln the Lord*s will be seen over them, And*ld His arrow will go forth like lightning. The*ld Lord God*s will blow the trumpet, And*ld go with whirlwinds from the south.

The*ld Lord*s of hosts will defend them; They*ld shall devour and subdue with slingstones. They*ld shall drink and*i roar as if with wine; They*ld shall be filled with*i blood*i like basins, Like*ld the corners of the altar.
The*ld Lord*s their God will save them in that day, As*ld the flock of His people. For*ld they shall*i be*i like*i the jewels of a crown, Lifted*ld like a banner over His land—
For*ld how great is its goodness And*ld how great its beauty! Grain*ld shall make the young men thrive, And*ld new wine the young women.
